data.title: If you like ... Terry Pratchett and Douglas Adams - Christchurch City Libraries - Christchurch City Libraries Ngā Kete Wānanga o Ōtautahi
data.meta_description: If you like ... Terry Pratchett and Douglas Adams - Christchurch City Libraries by  ChristchurchLib - a staff-created list : Terry Pratchett and Douglas Adams are the acknowledged kings of humorous and satirical fantasy and science fiction.  Here are some other writers whose books also contain some of the incredibly and lovingly clever silliness that we expect from Pratchett and Adams.  A Christchurch City Libraries list.
data.meta_site_name: Christchurch City Libraries Ngā Kete Wānanga o Ōtautahi
data.text:
Dark and hilarious humour is the name of the game here, so if you have an appreciation for the absurd then you will enjoy this one. Fforde's world-buildin...Show more Dark and hilarious humour is the name of the game here, so if you have an appreciation for the absurd then you will enjoy this one. Fforde's world-building is outstanding too - a richly detailed, zany account of life in a dystopian (and very cold) alternative Wales. The exposition is witty, and the story plays host to a large cast of rich and interesting characters. Show less

All copies in use. Availability details

In this sixth installment of the Hitchhiker's Guide to the Galaxy series, Arthur Dent has finally made it home to Earth, only to discover that it is about...Show more In this sixth installment of the Hitchhiker's Guide to the Galaxy series, Arthur Dent has finally made it home to Earth, only to discover that it is about to be blown up ... again. What could a pantheon of unemployed gods, everyone's favorite renegade Galactic President, a lovestruck green alien, an irritating computer, and at least one very large slab of cheese have to do with all of this? Show less

A fantastical and super-fun, adventurous, and hedonistic romp through a brilliantly inventive new world. The great war is over, but for how long? A bicycl...Show more A fantastical and super-fun, adventurous, and hedonistic romp through a brilliantly inventive new world. The great war is over, but for how long? A bicycle courier becomes entangled in more that he bargained for when he is suddenly promoted, but with the new role comes new responsibilities. His current existence of drugs, sex, and highbrow partying will come under threat and he is forced to not only look to the future, but also fight for values he never knew he had! Show less

Pratchett's Discworld universe is full of cowardly wizards, octagenarian barbarian heroes, exploding dragons, wickedly wise witches, giant dwarves, and an...Show more Pratchett's Discworld universe is full of cowardly wizards, octagenarian barbarian heroes, exploding dragons, wickedly wise witches, giant dwarves, and an orangutan librarian. Despite the silliness, though, the Discworld universe has its roots firmly in our own history, albeit the more obscure parts of it. And the characters are ones we all recognise and relate to. Go, read, and enjoy! Show less

All copies in use. Availability details

An amalgamation of William Shakespeare with Edgar Allen Poe, this satirical Venetian gothic is hard to pigeonhole. Three dastardly plotters invite an even...Show more An amalgamation of William Shakespeare with Edgar Allen Poe, this satirical Venetian gothic is hard to pigeonhole. Three dastardly plotters invite an even more dastardly dinner guest for a promised night of mayhem… then murder. Looking to dispose of the only roadblock to riches and respect, the three plotters eagerly await the aptly named “Fool”. But is he really? This isn’t Fools first rodeo, and he has plenty of tricks up his sleeve before the night ends. This book is a sequel to the original book where the character was first introduced, entitled “Fool”, but it is not essential reading to pick up the story. A bawdy tale filled with vulgarity and humour, read this if you like your Shakespeare stitched together with modern raunch Show less

There’s nothing worse than waking up and realising that history has changed, the German’s now have won WWII and all you can get for breakfast is bratwurst...Show more There’s nothing worse than waking up and realising that history has changed, the German’s now have won WWII and all you can get for breakfast is bratwurst and not a good old fashioned breakfast sausage. An absurd, funny and fantastical tale where it falls to our two protagonists to go back in time and fix whatever went wrong to get time back on track, solving 12 cases of cosmic conundrums that will hopefully lead them to the way to right the wrong now in world. Rankin's novels have a darker and more satirical feel to them than Pratchett's, and many are set in Brentford, London, which happens to be full of ancient evils and/or insane aliens. Read this if you like the absurdity of Douglas Adams. Show less

Anthony's world of Xanth is loosely based on Florida, and many of the characters that populate it are also based on our own folklore and myths. Existing a...Show more Anthony's world of Xanth is loosely based on Florida, and many of the characters that populate it are also based on our own folklore and myths. Existing alongside our own world of Mundania, Xanthians all have a unique talent, which can manifest itself in any number of ways. A wildly popular long-running series. Show less

A pheasant shooter is murdered and is reincarnated as one of these birds that he just loves to shoot and kill for sport. From there he embarks on a perilo...Show more A pheasant shooter is murdered and is reincarnated as one of these birds that he just loves to shoot and kill for sport. From there he embarks on a perilous journey to uncover who was responsible for his death. A great premise treated with a great deal of satirical humour makes this an enthralling and enjoyable read. Show less

Fans of darkly humorous cosmic capers such as John Connolly's Samuel Johnson Tales or Terry Pratchett and Neil Gaiman's Good Omens should enjoy The Everyt...Show more Fans of darkly humorous cosmic capers such as John Connolly's Samuel Johnson Tales or Terry Pratchett and Neil Gaiman's Good Omens should enjoy The Everything Box. The Heavenly Host's loss is humanity's gain when the angel Qaphsiel misplaces a very special box. It remains hidden until 2015, when Charlie "Coop" Cooper, a thief who specializes in stealing magical artefacts, purloins what he believes to be the score of a lifetime. Show less

All copies in use. Availability details

In a parallel universe the Crimean war is still going, and the West is controlled by the Goliath Corporation. Thursday Next is a war vet and literary det...Show more In a parallel universe the Crimean war is still going, and the West is controlled by the Goliath Corporation. Thursday Next is a war vet and literary detective who finds herself inside the novel Jane Eyre, and inadvertently alters the course of literary history. Highly recommended for all fans of literature both great and small, this is the first in a series featuring Thursday, her pet dodo Pickwick and sometimes existing fiance Landen Parke-Laine. Show less

All copies in use. Availability details

The world is ending, all the portents are indicating that time is up for humanity and the human world. Two angels (one fallen) have a long connection with...Show more The world is ending, all the portents are indicating that time is up for humanity and the human world. Two angels (one fallen) have a long connection with humanity and don't really want to see the end. Together they cooperate in an attempt to stave off the apocalypse in a rollicking adventure of good vs evil. Great read and now a TV series. Show less

All copies in use. Availability details Holds: 1 on 3 copies

A classic fantasy romance adventure story! who hasn't watched/read this hilarious tale. Be charmed by the sweet main characters buttercup and blah and ent...Show more A classic fantasy romance adventure story! who hasn't watched/read this hilarious tale. Be charmed by the sweet main characters buttercup and blah and entertained by the loveable funny adventure all in the name of true love. If you like quirky classic humour filled with entertaining characters give this one a try. Show less

Not Currently Available.Holds: 1 on 1 Copy

Place hold

A laugh out loud dark humorous read, if you like witty wild stories this reads like a Stephen King novel crossed with a stand-up comedy show. A new father...Show more A laugh out loud dark humorous read, if you like witty wild stories this reads like a Stephen King novel crossed with a stand-up comedy show. A new father has been chosen to be the keeper of death, juggling fatherhood, a goth death assistant and dark monsters. Prepare to be spooked, be in fits of laughter and deeply entertained. Show less

Clever writing, fast-paced and action-packed hilarious read that'll have you laughing out loud! Every fantasy trope becomes a bigger joke, adventures fill...Show more Clever writing, fast-paced and action-packed hilarious read that'll have you laughing out loud! Every fantasy trope becomes a bigger joke, adventures filled with tongue in cheek humour and a great many crude jokes. If you like adventurous fantasy but hate the many fantasy cliches give this one ago you might find you enjoy the puns and the mocking of all the fantasy tropes. Show less

All copies in use. Availability details Holds: 2 on 2 copies
